alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 6:31PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda and Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 630 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Jose, Fremont, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara, Milpitas, Cupertino, Campbell, Saratoga, Los Gatos, Sunol-Midtown, Buena Vista, Seven Trees, Alum Rock, Fruitdale, East Foothills, Rancho Rinconada Cdp, Monte Sereno, Cambrian Park and Rancho Rinconada. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
